revisions.rev:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Camo & Krooked | image = Amadeus Award 2010 entree Camo and Krooked.jpg | caption = Reitsch and Wagner at the 2010 Amadeus Awards | background = non_performing_personnel | origin = [[Vienna]], [[Austria]] | genre = [[Drum and bass]], [[Liquid Funk]], [[Dubstep]], [[Drumstep]] | years_active = 2007-present | label = [[Hospital Records]], [[Breakbeat Kaos]], Audio Porn, Viper Recordings, Beta Recordings, Mainframe Recordings | associated_acts = [[Nina]], [[Nemesis]], [[Dynamite MC]], [[DJ Friction (UK)|Friction]], [[Future Prophecies]], Shaz Sparks, DisasZt, Ayah Marar, [[Jenna Gibbons|Jenna G]], [[TC (musician)|TC]] | current_members = Reinhard Rietsch (2007-Present)
Markus Wagner (2007-Present) | past_members = }} '''Camo & Krooked''' are a [[Drum & Bass]] duo from [[Vienna]], [[Austria]] consisting of '''Reinhard Rietsch''' (aka Camo, Born November 12, 1983 in [[Salzburg]]) and '''Markus Wagner''' (aka Krooked, Born July 31, 1989 in [[Lilienfeld]]){{cite web|url=http://www.myspace.com/camokrooked|title=Camo & Krooked Myspace Bio |publisher=Drum And Bass |date= |accessdate=2011-03-26}} ==History== Both Rietsch and Wagner have been producing music since 2002. They met at one of Rietsch's gigs and collaborated to form Camo & Krooked in 2007. Their first release was in 2008 with ''Play It / Hidden Edge / Drop It!''.{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Camo-Squash-4-Camo-Krooked-Dont-Push-Me-No-More-Running/master/71229|title=Camo & Krooked - No More Running Discogs|publisher=Drum And Bass |date= |accessdate=2011-03-26}} Due to Camo & Krooked success with ''Above & Beyond'' released in February 2010, they won Best Newcomer DJ's at the 2010 Drum & Bass: Arena Awards, and put out two mixes for BBC Radio 1âs [[Annie Nightingale]], [[Fabio (DJ)|Fabio]] & [[Grooverider]]. [[Grooverider]] later quoted that Camo & Krooked are âone of the biggest talents in Drum & Bassâ.http://www.viperrecordings.co.uk/artist?id=999921 Both of these mixes bring to the table Camo & Krookedâs usual varying sub-genres of [[Drum & Bass]].{{cite web|url=http://www.headzwillrollnyc.com/?tag=markus-wagner|title=Headzwillrollnyc - Markus Wagner Discogs|publisher=Drum And Bass |date= |accessdate=2011-03-26}} Camo & Krooked were signed by [[Hospital Records]] on the December 4th 2010IMO Records [http://www.imorecords.co.uk/drumandbass/camo-and-krooked-biography/ "Camo & Krooked Biography"], ''[[IMO Records]]'', London, 18th October 2011. Retrieved on 23 November 2011. to join the likes of [[Netsky (musician)|Netsky]], [[High Contrast]] and [[Danny Byrd]]. On 3 June 2011,https://www.breakbeat.co.uk/mp3/camo-krooked/all-fall-down-feat-shaz-sparks.aspx Camo & Krooked released their first single from their upcoming album, "''[[All Fall Down (Camo & Krooked song) |All Fall Down / Breezeblock]]''" ventured into new genres for them into the realms of [[Dubstep]], "''All Fall Down''" reached number 97http://www.music-chart.info/song/706053/All-Fall-Down-%28feat--Shaz-Sparks%29 on the [[UK Singles Chart]] and number 14 on the [[UK Dance Chart]]. During 2011, due to the success and the release of "''All Fall Down''" and their growing Discography of songs, they played live at Festivals throughout Europe.http://festivalsearcher.com/artists.aspx?artist_id=Camo_and_Krooked Some of these gigs were alongside big names of the genre like [[Chase & Status]] & [[Sub Focus]], They performed at the [[Relentless (drink)|Relentless]]'s Nass festivalhttp://www.nassfestival.com/static.php?c=lineup and also at the [[Global Gathering]] festival,http://festivalsearcher.com/festivals.aspx?festival_id=global_gathering both in July 2011. In addition, they also headlined the [[Strongbow Cider|Strongbow]] stage at the [[V Festival]] in August 2011. The second single of Camo & Krooked's second album, "''Make The Call''" was released on 12 September 2011 with "''In The Future''" as the second track.http://shop.hospitalrecords.com/product/nhs193/ "''Make The Call''" is due to be their last released single prior to the album's release in the latter months of 2011, which in August 2011 was revealed to be named "''Cross The Line''"http://camoandkrooked.com/cross-the-line/. In BBC Radio 1's show of [[Fabio (DJ)|Fabio]] & [[Grooverider]] (12th of September), Camo & Krooked announced the album will be released on the 3rd of October. The Album is available on 12â³ Vinyl, CD and by Digital Download, the album was available for pre-order on [[iTunes]]. ''"Cross The Line"'' was released on 3 October 2011. On Decemeber 1st 2011, Camo & Krooked were awarded with the Best Producer title at the 2011 Drum and Bass Arena Awards. IMO Records. [ http://www.imorecords.co.uk/drumandbassnews/dnb-arena-awards-winners-2011/], ''[[IMO Records]]'', London, 02 Dec 2011.
